item.title: adding silly utils to Github Pages
item.description: I wanted to try a dumb and quick way to just draft up some silly util functions to speed up some mundane debugging I always do at my work. Process (…or lack thereof?) My main goal was to get something dirty and hacky; just short of a elegant CICD process. I have used Hugo-Papermod for the last almost 2 years or-so; so I just needed to get some static JS files boostrapped onto my hugo config and everything else can be left to the utils to do the heavy lifting.

item.title: using hatch for application development
item.description: A barebones exploration of the use of hatch, for the use of development of a simple Python application. Using this post as a form of reference or self-help link for python project set-up. Or, you can skip the step-by-step tedious explanation by jumping to the full pyproject.toml file.
